title: Joe Biden calls for condemnation of sexual violence by Hamas
summary: The US president on Tuesday forcefully denounced  'the horrific accounts of unimaginable cruelty' towards women during the October 7 attack and said Hamas had refused to release its remaining female hostages.

title: What is Hamas's next step?
summary: In interviews with Le Monde, leaders of the Islamist movement in Lebanon and Qatar promise to continue the fight against Israel in the absence of a political agreement.

title: Anthony Fauci: 'It wasn't against Trump. I was just trying to give the truth to the American people'
summary: On a visit to Paris to mark the 40th anniversary of the discovery of the HIV virus, the former chief medical advisor to seven US presidents looks back at the two great battles of his life: AIDS and Covid-19.

title: The UK's refugee crisis intensifies amid housing shortages and eviction pressures
summary: Following their asylum decision, applicants now have between seven and 28 days to vacate the hotels where they're accommodated. This poses a daunting task for both the applicants and the overwhelmed associations grappling with this new situation.

title: Zelensky abruptly cancels planned video meeting with US Senators
summary: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer revealed that the Ukrainian president's scheduled speech to US Senators – before their pivotal vote on a $60+ billion aid package for Kyiv – was unexpectedly canceled without explanation.

title: Women's football: England crush Scotland 6-0 but fail to secure Olympic qualification for Great Britain
summary: To keep their chance for the 2024 Olympics alive, the Lionesses had to win by a margin of at least three goals greater than the Netherlands' victory to win their group.

title: Peruvian court orders release of ex-president Alberto Fujimori
summary: Fujimori, 85, was serving a 25-year sentence in prison on charges of human rights abuses.

title: World Health Organization declares Gaza is reaching 'humanity's darkest hour'
summary: Bombings in previously safe southern areas, hastily displaced warehouses and critical shortages of medicine, beds and sanitation: The WHO and other UN agencies report an 'increasing disaster' in Gaza.

title: Jean-Luc Mélenchon's permanent conflict strategy
summary: The La France Insoumise leader, who has gone from polemic to polemic, once again caused a stir when he described television journalist Ruth Elkrief as a 'manipulator' and a 'fanatic' on Sunday, December 3.

title: UK and Rwanda strike new treaty, hoping to unblock controversial asylum plan
summary: British Home Secretary James Cleverly visited Rwanda to sign a new deal, after the British Supreme Court ruled last month that the UK's policy of sending asylum-seekers to Rwanda was unlawful.

title: Looking through the Very Large Telescope in the Atacama Desert
summary: Perched at 2,635 meters, the Cerro Paranal observatory in Chile offers a breathtaking view of a sky populated by a myriad of stars in an atmosphere of crystal clear quality.

title: White House warns Republicans that Ukraine faces diminishing funds
summary: Negotiations on a new aid package have stalled in Congress, with Republicans linking it to domestic policy matters such as cuts to tax services and restrictive immigration legislation.

title: How office tools like Slack and Teams create the illusion of productivity
summary: New digital managerial tools and innovations, which are supposed to promote efficiency within a team, can prevent employees from focusing on the core of their work by increasing demands made on their attention.

title: Malala: 'The Taliban have made girlhood illegal'
summary: The keynote speaker of the 21st Nelson Mandela Annual Lecture, Nobel Peace Prize laureate Malala Yousafzai delivered a speech calling for Afghanistan's 'gender apartheid' to be made a crime against humanity.

title: Ukraine opens arms procurement corruption investigation
summary: Oleksandr Klymenko, anti-corruption prosecution head, spoke of 'from €10-100 million' in contracts under investigation, but Kyiv has sworn that there was no 'misuse' of Western arms sent to fight the war against Russia.

title: Record number of fossil fuel lobbyists at COP28 talks, report NGOs
summary: Taken as a group, lobbyists outnumber 'every country delegation' apart from Brazil and the UAE, a coalition of NGOs said in a statement.

title: CO₂ emissions continue to rise in a world still heavily dependent on fossil fuels
summary: Emissions from coal, oil and gas continue to rise in 2023, warns the Global Carbon Project. They are soaring sharply in China, the world's largest emitter, while declining in the United States and Europe.

title: Israel pushes its military offensive to southern Gaza
summary: After the week-long truce between Israel and Hamas, fighting has spread to Khan Yunis, the largest town in the south of the enclave. For the trapped Palestinians, the humanitarian crisis is worsening.

title: Joe Biden calls for condemnation of sexual violence by Hamas
summary: The US president on Tuesday forcefully denounced  'the horrific accounts of unimaginable cruelty' towards women during the October 7 attack and said Hamas had refused to release its remaining female hostages.
